cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to curve north then northeast, skirting the South and North Carolina coastline before moving toward the Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the SC/NC border, close to Myrtle Beach, SC

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Georgia through North Carolina coasts, with primary impacts focused on the Carolina shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Only slight chance (<5%) of tropical-storm-force gusts; sustained winds expected well below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal run-up around 1 ft possible at high tide; significant surge not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands may bring 1â€“2 inches of rain; flooding not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along adjacent beaches.
